util

Class WeightedHashSet<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.WeightedHashSet<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The element type this set contains.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.util.Collection<T>, java.util.Set<T>

    public class WeightedHashSet<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Set<T>
    Implements a HashSet with weighted elements, and facilitates biased sampling.
    Author:
    Bitidork

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WeightedHashSet()
      Constructs an empty weighted set.
      WeightedHashSet(java.util.Collection<? extends T> c)
      Constructs a weighted set with items in the supplied collection c, all with weight 1.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(T e,
          float weight)
        Adds the given value to the set with the supplied weight.
        Parameters:
        e - The value to add.
        weight - The weight of the value.
        Returns:
        true if this set did not already contain the specified element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if weight is negative

      • getWeight

        public java.lang.Float getWeight(java.lang.Object o)
        Gets the weight of the supplied object. Objects not in the set have weight 0. Each set member has, by default, a weight of 1.
        Parameters:
        o - The object.
        Returns:
        Returns the weight of the object.

      • getWeight

        public java.lang.Float getWeight()
        Gets the sum of the weights of values in this set. This is done in constant time.
        Returns:
        Returns the sum of the weights of values in this set.

      • pickRandom

        public T pickRandom(java.util.Random rand)
        Picks a random element from this set biased by the weights of the elements. This method expects at least one element with non-zero weight.
        Parameters:
        rand - The random number generator to use.
        Returns:
        Returns the element picked from this set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the set is empty or has a total weight of 0

      • pickRandom

        public T pickRandom()
        Picks a random element from this set biased by the weights of the elements. This method expects at least one element with non-zero weight. This method uses the thread's local random number generator.
        Returns:
        Returns the element picked from this set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the set is empty or has a total weight of 0
        See Also:
        ThreadLocalRandom
